_comment: Created by EFisher on 26/03/2014 17:00:23 using v2.1
title: What is the regional variation in rates of cancelled elective operations in 2012/13?
analysis_commentary:
In 2012/2013, there was about a two-fold variation in the rate of cancelled elective operations between regions (defined by the old NHS Strategic Health Authorities boundaries). The best performer was the North East with a rate of 4.4 elective operations cancelled per 1,000 'elective' operations and the worst was the East of England rate of 9.6 .

Elective admissions have been calculated as the sum of the number of 'Planned Admissions' and 'Waiting List Admissions' in the published data from the Health and Social Care Information Centre's Provisional Monthly Hospital Episode Statistics.
data_source: NHS England, Cancelled Operations & Health and Social Care Information Centre, Provisional Monthly Hospital Episode Statistics
